Topic: Draw animals in their habitats with labels (e.g., fish in water).
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can accurately draw different plants and animals, including humans, correctly placed in their respective habitats.
The student can effectively label the areas where different plants and animals live, clearly indicating environments such as water, forests, and fields.
The student can comprehensively draw and label essential resources like water, air, sunlight, soil, and rocks in the context of animal and plant survival.
The student can clearly demonstrate relationships between plants and animals and the materials they need to survive, such as fish requiring water and deer needing leaves.
The student can successfully illustrate how habitats provide necessary resources for the survival of plants and animals.
The student can display how specific plants and animals are adapted to particular areas because those environments meet their needs, like fish naturally inhabiting water environments.
The student can explain through their drawing that plants, animals, and their habitats collaborate as a system to fulfill the needs of living organisms.
CANNOT: May occasionally miss a label or provide a vague label for an over-looked element (e.g., not labeling a tree in a forest scene).
Might inconsistently apply detail to all parts of the drawing (e.g., more detail on animals than plants, even though understanding is present).
